channel.title: [Tutorial] How to safely count the number of rows for a SELECT query with PDO
channel.description:
https://www.jamesmonger.com/post/how-to-safely-count-the-number-of-rows-for-a-select-query-with-pdo.html
[url=http://php.net/manual/en/pdostatement.rowcount.php]According the the PDO documentation[/url] we can use the rowCount() function to see how many rows are affected by an INSERT, DELETE or UPDATE statement. What about a SELECT statement? We can use rowCount() but it's not safe across all databases. I've written a small tutorial on how to safely count the number of rows in a statement.
